column4: I upgraded now my sound doesn't work. In /usr/share/alsa/cards my card is not listed. Does any one know where I can download a .conf file for a opl3sa2 card. Modprobes don't work anymore. That is how I got it to work when I first installed Ubuntu.
what did you upgrade?
crumsun: everything. I installed an old hard drive, to have more space. Then redid everything.
did you have to pass any options to modprobe the first time?
Yes, now they do nothing. For some reason also "modprobe opl3sa" gets an error. I originally used modprobe then edited the modprobe.d.
so you were using the oss/free driver and not the alsa one/

I believe I was using both. I also added aliases to the alsa config. The forums listed various things to do, but nothing works now. I read on the forums also opl3sa2 cards aren't supported anymore. It normally would take this long to set it up, but I used to be able to use alsaconf, Ubuntu doesn't have that.
you can't use both at the same time; you can only use one or the other
pastebin the output from lsmod
These are the only refs to sound... opl3sa2                11872  0
mpu401                 28388  1 opl3sa2
sound                  81832  3 opl3sa2,ad1848,mpu401
soundcore              10176  1 sound
and that's the oss/free driver, not the alsa one
you need to unload all of those, then load snd-opl3sa2
Could you elaborate on unload?
sudo modprobe -r opl3sa2
whishkah@ubuntu:~$ sudo modprobe snd-opl3sa2
sh: line 1: 20850 Segmentation fault      modprobe --ignore-install snd-opl3sa2
FATAL: Error running install command for snd_opl3sa2
lsmod output -> pastebin
snd_opl3sa2            18415  1
